name: Junius BURNO, Petitioner v. The COURT OF COMMON PLEAS OF LEHIGH COUNTY, Respondent
name_abbreviation: Burno v. Court of Common Pleas of Lehigh County

pin_cites.parenthetical: explaining that hybrid representation is not permitted
explaining that hybrid representation is not permitted

judges: Justice EAKIN did not participate in the decision of this matter.
parties: Junius BURNO, Petitioner v. The COURT OF COMMON PLEAS OF LEHIGH COUNTY, Respondent.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM.
AND NOW, this 24th day of December, 2015, the Application for Leave to File Original Process and the Petition for Writ of Mandamus and/or Extraordinary Relief are DISMISSED. See Commonwealth v. Ali, 608 Pa. 71, 10 A.3d 282 (2010) (explaining that hybrid representation is not permitted). The Prothonotary is DIRECTED to forward the filings to counsel of record.
Justice EAKIN did not participate in the decision of this matter.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM.

casebody.head_matter:
129 A.3d 1235
Junius BURNO, Petitioner v. The COURT OF COMMON PLEAS OF LEHIGH COUNTY, Respondent.
No. 131 EM 2015.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Dec. 24, 2015.
